headline: Chocolate Cupcakes
description: These chocolate cupcakes are super moist and bursting with rich, chocolaty flavor. Top with your favorite frosting for any party or special event.

video.description: These cupcakes are moist, delicious, and easy to make.
video.name: Chocolate Cupcakes

name: Chocolate Cupcakes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a muffin pan with paper or foil liners.
Sift together flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Cream together sugar and butter in a large bowl until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla. Add flour mixture in two batches, alternating with milk; beat well.
Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the centers comes out clean, 15 to 17 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool before serving or frosting.

review.reviewBody: i honestly think that the people that gave a bad review were people that didn‚Äôt follow the instructions because my one turned out perfectly with a moist texture
Turned out Beautifully! I never use all purpose flour, I always use self rising. I used half cup milk and half cup strong coffee. Recipe made 18 Delicious Cupcakes!!
Very good chocolate cupcake recipe. I added 1 Tbsp of strongly brewed coffee to help bring out the rich chocolate flavor.

I made these cupcakes today for my husbands birthday. I didn‚Äôt change anything, I followed recipe as is and I got 18 cupcakesüòÄ I didn‚Äôt try yet but I made peanut butter frosting to go on top as it‚Äôs my husbands favorite. They are finished üòâ
I only doubled the butter, didnt make the icicng. The result was light, fluffy chocolate cupcake, not too moist, infact on the dry side. But tasted good :)
When I took the Cupcakes out of the oven the were all crumbly I couldn‚Äôt put frosting on them they were so crumbly. I don‚Äôt recommend.
super moist, makes alot but the cupcake is great
Great and very light to eat. Made with a 8 year old and a 1 year old... Super fun and reccomend.

If you‚Äôre going to change the recipe at least rate the recipe on the way it was written THEN note your changes that you feel made it 4/5 stars. Made these exactly as written. These are dry‚Ä¶very dry! Cooking time didn‚Äôt change that. So frustrating to waste time on a recipe with high reviews only to have it be worse that I could have got from a box of cake mix.
Love this recipe! Easy & delicious, light & airy. I made French Buttercream frosting. Everyone loved them
this was absolutley amazing excpet the recipe said to bake it for 15-17 minutes but i had to end up baking it for about 20 minutes so yeah
I added a little more butter and one more egg. What made it was adding chocolate chips which melt and ooze out when you eat! Addicting!
It wasn‚Äôt so strong but it was a simple and for the most part delicious recipe
My family says it's the best cupcakes they have ever had. Super easy to make. Make sure you do 3/4 filled thought because they over flowed a bit. All in all great recipe.
I always add the cocoa to the creamed butter and sugar before adding the flour and other dry ingredients. Adding the cocoa with the fats makes sense, and increases the chocolatey flavor.
It was fun to make and to see the joy in my family's eyes was amazing.

Excellent recipe. I doubled the butter, which made them perfectly moist. A tip: this recipe has little to nothing to do with whether or not you get a raised top. The temperature and time are what create that. Try heating the oven to 400, then, when you put them in, lowering to 350 or 375 and baking for 10-15 minutes. I did a "test" cupcake first. Try that to see how yours do before putting them all in. This gave me a nice raised top. I filled the cups about 3/4 like the recipe says, which is perfect for a raised top, but if you don't want a raised top, 1/2 is probably better.
This is my 3rd or 4th time making them and they come out perfect each and every time! It made 43 mini cupcakes! Whoever said they come out crumbly are definitely doing something wrong!
We made mini cupcakes they tasted good but the top collapsed on some of them.
Wonderful, decadent chocolate cupcakes!
I love these yummy cupcakes for National Chocolate Cupcake Day make these because they are good
I love this recipe.
It did not turn out well. It was super soft and just disintegrated.
They were SUPER yummy kids loved them!
I loved it it was sooo moist and tasted great
I wish I could put 6 stars because this is AMAZING. These DELICIOUS cupcakes are so light and yummy and easy that I did a dance when I ate one. Whoever sees this recipe, make it RIGHT NOW!
AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING!! Must try!

I tried these cupcakes, following the recipe exactly, and found them very disappointing. They were chewy, and though the taste was okay I have had much better chocolate cupcakes. I topped mine with homemade chocolate whipped cream and marshmallow halves. They were easy to make, but the texture was terrible. The cupcake itself looked beautiful. It was flat topped, exactly like in the video, which was nice because then my whipped cream didn't slide off. They rose nicely and were well rounded. But I couldn't get past that texture. I won't be making these again, sorry.
I love this resepi.

I made this. I made 2 alterations. I swapped 1/2 cup of milk for buttermilk and also swapped butter for oil. The result was indeed a moist chocolate cake. BUT, It just didn‚Äôt hold its shape! It sank in the middle. So I didn‚Äôt like it. I made the recipe for 16 cupcakes, but the yield was about 22 for me. I did fill the cupcake liners about 3/4 of the way as mentioned. Was I doing something wrong?
I love this recipe, it's perfect. I just use less chocolate because we like them a bit less strong.
It was the best I added red food coloring for valentines üíó
My son's favorite cake!
Amazing,easy, and quick

I did not like this recipe. Something that I think is very important for a cup cake or any muffin in general is the top. This cupcake had no top. Only the butt other wise know as the bottom part. The cupcake doesn't really have much flavor. I followed this recipe down to the t. If anything it tasted like one of those mug cakes you can make in a microwave. No offense to the creator of the recipe but these cupcakes just aren't my favorite.
I have made cupcakes using your recipe, my husband absolutely loves the cakes, trust me he isn't a big fan of sweets. Needless to say I make these all the time.

I adjusted the recipe to make 2 dozen chocolate cupcakes and painted it with an original buttercream frosting. The chocolate cupcakes turned out nicely, but I feel they needed a little something to make the chocolate flavour kick. 
My next batch I‚Äôll be adding a little bit of roasted ground espresso, but overall, this recipe was yummy & didn‚Äôt last on the tray for long

This cake was decadent and delicious. I substituted oat milk for milk and it turned out great!

It is a bit thick so the only thing I would change is creating it as a cake instead of cupcakes.
I was t sure which recipe to follow it gave me 2 different ones and the one I went with my cupcakes sunk in and had to much coaco I‚Äôm very disappointed
It was very delicious! They weren‚Äôt super cakey which I enjoyed. Very nice recipe.
Too much chocolate powder it made it taste bitter
It made my hair look good.

I was almost afraid to make these after the reviews of them spilling over and messing up ovens and being dry. Generally, I like to stick to the recipe first time making so I did that and everything worked out fine. I filled the cups 3/4 as usual and did not have any overflow catastrophes. Used the simple buttercream frosting and put chocolate sprinkles on. They were amazing and the family gobbled them all up! Would definitely make again - family is asking when I will make them.
Excellent ! I have made it now several times and it turns out delicious every single time. If your a chocolate lover , this recipe is for you :)
really great recipe. Very easy and my cupcakes turned out perfect!

These came out amazing! The kids and the adults loved it. I made sure to beat it enough to give the batter almost a mousse like consistency, which made them super soft and moist. I also used whole milk.
It‚Äôs was perfect just the right amount of sweet and really good
Simply amazing
I love these cupcakes! They are so moist and decadent.

Absolutely perfect. I can't believe how quick it was to make and how tasty it came out. It goes perfect with almost any buttercream topping, and the black color is great with most cupcake wrappers. Over all, this was an amazing recipe!
These are so so yummy!!!! My friends and family love them. Just as an extra, I add a few chocolate chips in the mix.

Definitely only fill halfway unless you want them to look like squished muffins. They taste Amazing! And they are supper easy. I injected raspberry jam in a batch and they were loved by all. I frosted them with ‚ÄúRicks special buttercream frosting‚Äù . Perfect for decorating
Excellent recipe and yes only fill the cupcakes half way, they come out perfect... enjoy!

Delicious, but not as moist as we‚Äôd like. A few suggestions to tweak the recipe: (1) add more butter (twice as much than what‚Äôs called for) to the sugar & to cream, (2) utilize just 1/2 C cocoa powder as the 3/4 C dried out the cupcakes, (3) fill up the cupcake tin just 1/2 full, as they rise a bit, (4) use a chocolate cream frosting on top & to make them over the top delicious! If you filled the cupcake gin 1/2 full you‚Äôd yield 24 cupcakes, which is not a bad thing! Thanks for sharing the recipe!
Hated this recipe because I used this recipe by accident for a second time looking for good cupcake recipes and it ruined my night and my kids night
They are amazing cupcakes, and although they are more like muffins, I still love them. They also taste especially delicious with powdered sugar sprinkled on top.
A bit dry but very yummy.
had to add butter, 1/2 cup.turned out good
i added more butter and added some sour cream!! also added chocolate chips and these were so good.

I wasn‚Äôt planning on making cupcakes today but mum brother was having a really stressful day so I decided to make him some cupcakes. This wasn‚Äôt one of the first recipes I saw and I liked the picture so I clicked on it, I saw that they only took 30 minutes to make and I decided to make them since I had a call with my teacher in about an hour. So I made them, following the recipe almost exactly except I usefully oat milk instead of Cows milk. I expected them to be mediocre because of the reviews but honestly, these were really good. The only negative thing I can say about them is that they were a bit difficult to take out of the pan because of how soft they were, but other than that I think they‚Äôre perfect, an the softness is more a positive thing than a negative thing. Honestly they didn‚Äôt even need frosting but I still added a little bit (mostly for decoration).
I am not sure how this recipe gets such high marks, may be because they are so easy and low fat! Cupcakes were dry and without much flavor. No one in my family liked them!

If I could give this zero stars I would!! OMG do not make these. They don't rise at all and they flatten out like a pancake!!! I followed all of the directions step by step. They turned out horrible. Had to make an entire new batch.
The cupcakes were soo soft and good they were gone in minutes.

I didn‚Äôt even bother baking it. The batter tasted weird. The texture was weird. I should have known it was going to be different when I wasn‚Äôt using buttermilk, oil, or hot water. I definitely would never recommend this recipe. The cupcakes were probably going to come out dry and tasteless. I‚Äôve made my fair share of chocolate cupcakes for my kids. All I know is oil and hot water/coffee makes a great cupcake. I wasn‚Äôt thinking this morning. It‚Äôs just a waste of ingredients.

I LOVED this recipe! I'm not hard to please, so it's really not a big deal if I had to add a bit of extra butter to cream the butter and sugar together! 

yes, it may be annoying to some, but after I made a few adjustments, I had a great outcome! 

I liked to add extra Cocao Powder for extra Chocolatey flavor! if I didn't like the consistency, I just added a bit more milk! 

GREAT RECIPE!! I've made it a few times now and it's my go to!

I made this recipe exactly as it says except for I filled them about half full and they turned out great! It made 20 cupcakes and I used a brown sugar chocolate frosting on them. Next time I'll bake them for 15 minutes instead of 17 so they come out a little gooeyer. I need to practice on my frosting ability though...lol

Flavor is good, but even filling only half full, due to other reviews, and using 3/4 cup milk vs full cup, they rose too high and then collapsed. Not something I normally have happen and I'm an experienced baker. Useless as frostable cupcakes, used them topped with ice cream or whipped cream. Really surprised this recipe showed up as a top staff pick.
This recipe was AMAZING!!! So much fun to bake!

it was very good, the perfect amount of sweet and bitter, I hope others will make this recipe, and enjoy as much as I and my children did. 
one of the twins, (Dixie, and Sophia) loved it, the other (Sophia) didn't so much, but that is because she has quite the sweet tooth! thank you anyway. this is my number 1 recipe choice!
My 9 year old daughter made these for me, and they were the best cupcakes I‚Äôve ever tasted. Thank you for the recipe, they were a masterpiece.
I did it exactly how the recipe said and it turned out amazing!

Ok so I am retyping a new response out with a couple more tips. The cupcakes definitely turned out moist for me but a couple things you should watch out for is the bake time and how much you fill the liners with. Instead of 3/4 I highly recommend 1/2 also 17 minutes does not cut it! Bake for around 20 minutes. Lastly, we added homemade strawberry jam in the inside once they baked and frosted it with a chocolate frosting and it tasted delicious!
Best chocolate cupcake recipe that I have used in a long time. Light and full of flavor

I made these for mi kid‚Äôs Junior Graduation and, let me tell you, they were absolutely amazing. They are crisp, not too sweet, fluffy, just the right amount of chocolate flavor. I topped them with a chocolate butter cream, to die for, but they are as good just plain. Although, as I read in some of the reviews, I altered slightly the recipe according to my experience. In used 1/2 cup of butter (1 stick), a full tablespoon of vanilla, and definitely filled the cupcake liners at half; no regrets. This recipe really makes 30 cupcakes.
Perfect recipe. I substituted some cocoa powder with matcha powder for half of the mixture and added some extra flour to make chocolate and matcha cupcakes. Came out great!

Came across this recipe while looking for a quick and simple chocolate cupcake recipe that I could whip up using pantry staples for my daughter. Directions were easy to follow and my daughter (2.5 yrs old) really enjoyed ‚Äúhelping‚Äù me! After reading the reviews, I doubled the butter. Also ended up baking an additional 10 min, so 25 min total (I used silicone pans). I only filled the cups about 2/3 full and one pan overflowed (on lower rack), while the other did not, which was interesting (I couldn‚Äôt fit both on the middle rack). The cupcakes came out super moist (almost brownie like), light, soft and very very sweet. I was going to make a chocolate buttercream frosting, but opted for a fresh whipped cream frosting instead to try to balance the sweetness and decadence of the cake. Next time, I will cut the sugar down bc it‚Äôs just too sweet and may decrease the butter to recipe‚Äôs recommended amount
My first time making cupcakes from scratch! I'm glad I used this recipe. It's delicious! Thank you!
Tasted more like bread than cupcakes

Super good!! I made it as a cake.
If you would want to make a PB cake just add 1 tablespoon once you mix everything together. Really good a bit dry though i would suggest adding a bit more milk than they say.
Cupcakes were bland, was told to fill the wrapper too high in the directions and they came out deflated and disappointing. Would not recommend this recipe.
Flavor is great but I followed the recipe exactly and my first batch overflowed and the second batch I didn‚Äôt fill as much and they are sunk in the center. I will look for a different recipe
Just put mine in the oven. Hard to resist the batter as it smells so good when you mix it all together.
So good
I love the chocolate cupcakes! They are so good. I found out if you dont have coco powder you can use hot chocolate mix instead.
They were great but a little to big you should probably only fill it 2/3 of the way or 1/2 if you want smaller cupcakes
Raw inside despite extra baking time.

I filled the muffins cups 3/4 full like the recipe said, but the batter ended up spilling out of the cups and onto the bottom of the oven. Also, the recipe says to cream 3 tablespoons butter with 1 1/2 cups sugar, but using that little butter makes the batter grainy and not fluffy. Did not like this recipe at all.
It was a great recipe, the cupcakes came out AMAZING! Would definitely recommend that everyone try this recipe out!
these cupcakes are awesome. Everyone loved them. i was able to get 18 cupcakes. will make again.
Very good had a dense brownie texture
Need to cut down on sugar, super sweet!!!

I swear by this recipe. The only modification I make is with the milk. I use 80% of whatever milk amount it asked for and 20% lemon juice. Amazing. I even use it for Chocolate Cake in a 9-inch tin not only cupcakes

Great recipe to use as a base. I made it into a delicious, moist and fluffy chocolate cake with the following adjustments: 
Replaced 1 cup milk with 1/4 cup coffee + 3/4 cup milk
Added 1/2 cup sour cream
Yielded 2 loaves of cake (the rectangle dishes used for banana bread and marble bread)

I raised the butter to 1/4 (1/2 stick).

Lowered the sugar to 1cup. (when adding frosting you don't need the cake too sweet.)
Raised the Vanilla to a teaspoon and dumped it into the milk. (didn't see any point in leaving out a smidgen of Vanilla).
Good recipe, made about 18 cakes.
Used a quick and easy cocoa frosting.
(Justataste.com/5-minute-chocolate-buttercream-frosting-recipe)
Delicious, light and fluffy. We iced ours with Nutella!! This will definitely be a ‚Äògo to‚Äô recipe :)
Absolutely amazing!
There is too much baking soda in this recipe I‚Äôd try bumping it down to one tsp. Also there is not enough butter; I used 8tbsp.
It is yummylicious and coming from me its awesome because I'm quite picky when it comes to cake recipes
I thought that this recipe was very great, and amazing. But, I used maple syrup instead of vanilla extract, and it was amazing. Very easy to make, but tastes like it took all day.
